qas.question: Besides fuels and paving, what accounts for most of the other use of bitumen?
What lacquer is bitumen used to make for iron and steel production?
Why is Japan black used for outdoor paint?
Besides weather resistance, why else is Japan black used in paints?
What product is bitumen used in manufacturing as a sealant?
What accounts for nearly all the remaining graffiti consumption?
Other uses of paint or ink include cattle sprays, fence- post treatments and what else?
Cattle sprays can be used to seal what type of batteries?
What lacquer is known for its use on paint and ink?
What lacquer is used to make the color lighter?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Roofing shingles<b5_0/><a0_0/> account for most of the remaining asphalt/bitumen consumption. Other uses include cattle sprays, fence-post treatments, and <b6_0>waterproofing for fabrics<b6_0/>. Asphalt/bitumen is used to make <a1_0><b8_0><b9_0>Japan black<b9_0/><b8_0/><a1_0/>, a lacquer known especially for its use on iron and steel, and it is also used in paint and marker inks by some graffiti supply companies to increase the <a2_0>weather resistance<a2_0/> and <a3_0>permanence<a3_0/> of the paint or ink, and to make the color much darker.[citation needed] Asphalt/bitumen is also used to seal some <a4_0><b7_0>alkaline<b7_0/> batteries<a4_0/> during the manufacturing process.
